cover is a Eurasian super root

𓎡 𓊪 𓊶 cover "roof"

𓎡 𓄿 𓊪 𓄿 𓊪 𓇮 | cover | חפז châpha կափարիչ kapʿaričʿ խուփ xupʿ καπάκι kapáki капак kapak хавтас xavtas
𓎡 𓄿 𓊪 𓏏 𓆳 covered < καλύπτω kalúptō
𓍿 𓊪 𓎛 𓏏 𓉐 cavern | cyphert covert @ Cyperus cave

𓐍 𓆑 𓅱 Khufu cover guard "Protector" ⇔ 𓎸 𓃝 Khnum

𓌲 𒅗𒁀𒁍 ka-ba-bu kababuʳ "shield" 𓂚

𒋙 šú super > cover

𓇋 𓎼 𓊪 𓇲 | overcast, cloud cover | a'gopher 𓎼 𓊪 𓇲 cover

cover in english and semitic languages are almost the same word, either very old cognates or a loan word.
However the semitic branch is much broader and at its center is the word

Altaic: k[ā]p'á to cover, sack: Tung. *kup-; Mong. *kab-t-; Turk. *Kāp; Jpn. *kàmpú-. PTung. *kup-

𓎼 𓄿 𓃀 𓂢 kaf = arm

𓎡 𓆑 𓏛 | uncover, unclothe, doff (clothes), strip, deprive, despoil | √cover

𓀄 cover ⇔ kauern

cover itself is part of the cyper/super root,
meaning high(est) head:cephal over above.
Super-Dachung > Cover-Dachung > Überdachung

Schatz < Schutz < Schultz < Schildh 𐍃𐌺𐌹𐌻𐌳𐌿𐍃 s'gilde s'keyt < sCOVERT > shed Halde Schale shell hall

𒄭𒇲 HI.la₂ cover (with hides)
𒄭𒇲 HI.la₂ heil- < καλύπτω kalúptō ⇔ occulō

𓎛 𓃀 𓋴 𓋳 ma.hrbst "covering" ⇔
𓏱 morbid ⇔ Mureybet مريبط 'covered'
